headline.main: Queen Elizabeth National Park Journal; Grumpy and Big Eaters, Refugees Are Welcomed

lead_paragraph: It is hard to spot the recent refugees from the fighting next door in Congo, but Jacob Ochen, a tour guide, did and he proclaimed them good for business. He recalled driving around the park in December with a German tourist and his American wife when they came across a group of elephants acting much more aggressively than elephants here usually do. One trampled after their car and then charged it.
abstract: Uganda's Queen Elizabeth National Park has become haven for approximately 100 elephants fleeing civil war in neighboring Congo; animals have been welcomed in country where wildlife is only hope for reviving seriously slumping tourist trade; map; photos (M)
